Metadata Version.Description: SDS version number, e.g. 2.0.0. DO NOT CHANGE

Type.Description: Each dataset consists of a single “type” of data, covered by the same ethics, same access control, same protocol, etc. There are two datasets types,  experimental and computation. Experimental is the default value. Make sure to change it to computation only if you are submitting a computational study. If the dataset is not” computational”, it should be set to “experimental”

Title.Description: Descriptive title for the data set. Equivalent to the title of a scientific paper.

Subtitle.Description: Brief description of the study and the data set. Equivalent to the abstract of a scientific paper. Include the rationale for the approach, the types of data collected, the techniques used, formats and number of files and an approximate size.
Subtitle.Example: A really cool dataset that I collected to answer some question.

Keywords.Description: A set of keywords to assist in search.

Study purpose.Description: A description of the study purpose for the structured abstract.
Study purpose.Example: This study was conducted to demonstrate data wranglers how to fill out dataset templates.

Study data collection.Description: A description of the study data collection process for this dataset.
Study data collection.Example: Using an earlier version of this template we measured how much it confused data wranglers by counting the number of emails we had to exchange with them in order to fill it out.

Study primary conclusion.Description: A description of the primary conclusion drawn from the study for the structured abstract.
Study primary conclusion.Example: The primary conclusion of this study is that it is hard to make a good dataset template.

Study organ system.Description: The major organ systems related to this study.

Study approach.Description: The experimental approach or approaches taken in this study.

Study technique.Description: The experimental techniques used in this study.

Study collection title.Description: Title of the larger collection to which this dataset belongs.

Contributor name.Description: Name of any contributors to the dataset.  These individuals need not have been authors on any publications describing the data, but should be acknowledged for their role in producing and publishing the data set.  If more than one, add each contributor in a new column.

Contributor role.Description:
Contributor role. At most one PrincipalInvestigator and at least one CorrespondingAuthor are required. These roles are provided by the Data Cite schema. Options are:
PrincipalInvestigator
Creator
CoInvestigator
CorrespondingAuthor
DataCollector
DataCurator
DataManager
Distributor
Editor
Producer
ProjectLeader
ProjectManager
ProjectMember
RelatedPerson
Researcher
ResearchGroup
Sponsor
Supervisor
WorkPackageLeader
Other

Identifier description.Description: A description of the referent of the related identifier.
Identifier description.Example: The protocol use to generate this dataset.

Relation type.Description:
The relationship of this dataset to its related identifier. For example, if the identifier is the originating article, it would be “this dataset IsDescribedBy the originating article”. Options are
IsProtocolFor
HasProtocol
IsSoftwareFor
HasSoftware
IsCitedBy
Cites
IsSupplementTo
IsSupplementedBy
IsContinuedByContinues
IsDescribedBy
Describes
HasMetadata
IsMetadataFor
HasVersion
IsVersionOf
IsNewVersionOf
IsPreviousVersionOf
IsPartOf
HasPart
IsPublishedIn
IsReferencedBy
References
IsDocumentedBy
Documents
IsCompiledBy
Compiles
IsVariantFormOf
IsOriginalFormOf
IsIdenticalTo
IsReviewedBy
Reviews
IsDerivedFrom
IsSourceOf
IsRequiredBy
Requires
IsObsoletedBy
Obsoletes

Identifier.Description: The identifier for something related to this dataset. For example, the DOI or the relative path to the protocol generated by the Protocols.io, and/or the UUID generated by 12L digital twin platform.

Identifier type.Description: The type of the identifier. For example, DOI/path for protocol, and/or an UUID if referencing to a primary dataset already deposited in the 12L digital twin platform.

Number of subjects.Description: Number of unique subjects in this dataset, should match subjects metadata file.

Number of samples.Description: Number of unique samples in this dataset, should match samples metadata file. Set to zero if there are no samples.

subject id.Description: Lab-based schema for identifying each subject, should match folder names.

pool id.Description: If data is collected on multiple subjects at the same time include the identifier of the pool where the data file will be found. If this is included it should be the name of the top level folder inside primary.

subject experimental group.Description: Experimental group subject is assigned to in research project.

age.Description: Age of the subject (e.g., hours, days, weeks, years old) or if unknown fill in with “unknown”.

sex.Description: Sex of the subject, or if unknown fill in with “Unknown”.

RRID for strain.Description: Research Resource Identifier Identification (RRID) for the strain For this field.

age category.Description: Description of age category from derived from UBERON life cycle stage.

age range (min).Description: The minimal age (youngest) of the research subjects. The format for this field: numerical value + space + unit (spelled out).

age range (max).Description: The maximal age (oldest) of the research subjects. The format for this field: numerical value + space + unit (spelled out).

genotype.Description: Ignore if RRID is filled in, Genetic makeup of genetically modified alleles in transgenic animals belonging to the same subject group.

handedness.Description: Preference of the subject to use the right or left hand, if applicable.

reference atlas.Example: Paxinos and Watson, The Rat Brain In Stereotaxic Coordinates, 7th Ed, 2013

experimental log file path.Description: A file containing experimental records for each sample.

protocol title.Description: Once the research protocol is uploaded to Protocols.io, the title of the protocol within Protocols.io must be noted in this field.

subject id.Description: Lab-based schema for identifying each subject.

sample id.Description: Lab-based schema for identifying each sample, must be unique.

was derived from.Description: sample_id of the sample from which the current sample was derived (e.g., slice, tissue punch, biopsy, etc.).

pool id.Description: If data is collected on multiple samples at the same time in-clude the identifier of the pool where the data file will be found.

sample experimental group.Description: Experimental group subject is assigned to in research project. If you have experimental groups for samples please add another column.

sample type.Description: Physical type of the specimen from which the data were extracted.

sample anatomical location.Description: The organ, or subregion of organ from which the data were extracted.

protocol title.Description: Once the research protocol is uploaded to Protocols.io, the title of the protocol within Protocols.io must be noted in this field.

TSR1: Define Context Clearly Rating (0-4.Description: Develop and document the subject, purpose and intended use(s) of model, simulation or data processing (MSoP) submission

TSR2: Use Appropriate Data Rating (0-4).Description: Employ relevant and traceable information in the development or operation of the MSoP submission

TSR2: Use Appropriate Data Reference.Description: Reference to relevant and traceable information employed in the development or operation

TSR3: Evaluate Within Context Rating (0-.Description: Verification, validation, uncertainty quantification and sensitivity analysis of the submission are accomplished with respect ot the reality of interest and intended use(s) of MSoP

TSR3: Evaluate Within Context Reference.Description: Reference to verification, validation, uncertainty quantification and sensitivity analysis

TSR4: List Limitations Explicitly Rating.Description: Restrictions, constraints or qualifications for, or on, the use of the submission are available for consideration by the users

TSR4: List Limitations Explicitly Refere.Description: Reference to restrictions, constraints or qualifcations for use

TSR5: Use Version Control Rating (0-4).Description: Implement a system to trace the time history of MSoP activities, including delineation of contributors' efforts

TSR6: Document Adequately Rating (0-4).Description: Maintain up-to-date informative records of all MSoP activities, including simulation code, model mark-up, scope and intended use of the MSoP activities, as well as users' and developers' guides

TSR7: Disseminate Broadly Rating (0-4).Description: Publish all components of MSoP including simulation software, models, simulation scenarios and results

TSR8: Get Independent Reviews Rating (0-.Description: Have the MSoP submission reviewed by nonpartisan third-party users and developers

TSR9: Test Competing Implementations Rat.Description: Use contrasting MSoP execution strategies to compare the conclusions of the different execution strategies against each other

TSR10a: Conform to Standards Rating (0-4.Description: Adopt and promote generally applicable and discipline-specific operating procedures, guidelines and regulation accepted as best practices

Ann1: Code Verification Status.Description: Provide assurance that the MSoP submissions is free of bugs in the source code and numerical algorithms (yes/no)

Ann2: Code Validation Status.Description: Assess the degree to which a computer model and simulation framework is able to simulate a reality of interest

Ann3: Certification Status.Description: The code has been certified externally (yes/no)

Ann3: Reference to Certification.Description: Reference to the certification, if it has been certified

Ann4: Onboarded to o\u00b2S\u00b2PARC St.Description: The MSoP submission has been integrated into the o²S²PARC platform and is publicly available

Ann4: Reference to onboarded MSoP submis.Description: The name of the onboarded service or template on the o²S²PARC platform

Ann5: Testing on o\u00b2S\u00b2PARC Stat.Description: The MSoP submission includes unit and integration testing on the o²S²PARC platform

Ann5: Testing on o\u00b2S\u00b2PARC Refe.Description: Reference to the tests run on the onboarded MSoP submission

Representation in CellML.Description: Analogous CellML/SED-ML model representation, if any

Service Alias (User-given name).Description: Name of the service containing this input, given by the user
Service Alias (User-given name).Example: Name of the service containing this input, given by the user

Service name.Description: Name of the service containing this input
Service name.Example: Name of the service containing this input

Service version.Description: Version of the service containing this input
Service version.Example: Version of the service containing this input

Name.Description: An input field to the MSoP submission
Name.Example: An input field to the MSoP submission

Data Ontology Identifier.Description: Ontology identifier for the input field, if applicable
Data Ontology Identifier.Example: Ontology identifier for the input field, if applicable

Data Type.Description: Data type for the input field (in plain text)
Data Type.Example: Data type for the input field (in plain text)

Data Units.Description: Units of data for the input field, if applicable
Data Units.Example: Units of data for the input field, if applicable

Data Default Value.Description: Default value for the input field, if applicable (doi or value)
Data Default Value.Example: Default value for the input field, if applicable (doi or value)

Milestone completion date.Description: Date of milestone completion. This date starts the countdown for submission (30 days after completion), length of embargo and publication date (12 months from completion of milestone)
